snippet: Americans admire financial success, but they don’t always reward it at the ballot box.
abstract: Robert J Shiller Economic View column observes that while Americans admire financial success, they have not elected many businessmen as presidents; holds that voters usually recognize that other factors, like wise policies and strong leadership ability, are much more important than business acumen.
lead_paragraph: Americans admire financial success, but they don’t always reward it at the ballot box.

headline.print_headline: Businessmen As Presidents: A Historical Circle
headline.seo: Businessmen as U.S. Presidents: A Historical Circle
headline.main: Businessmen as Presidents: A Historical Circle
